abstract: European Court of Human Rights rules in favor of Russian protester Yevgeniy Frumkin, who was sentenced to two weeks in jail for jaywalking at political rally in Moscow in 2012, and orders Russian government to pay Frumkin more than $30,000 in damages and expenses; says there was no way Frumkin could comply with police officer's demands given tight confines and large crowd of people.
lead_paragraph: The European Court of Human Rights ruled in favor of a Russian man who was detained during a political rally in 2012 and who was sentenced to two weeks in jail for jaywalking.

headline.main: European Court Orders Russia to Pay Damages to Protester
headline.print_headline: Russia Is Ordered to Pay Damages to a Protester

snippet: The European Court of Human Rights ruled in favor of a Russian man who was detained during a political rally in 2012 and who was sentenced to two weeks in jail for jaywalking.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
